alert.note: Alert for Ferry (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 8:56PM PDT until May 11 at 8:38PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew affecting Ferry County. For the Kettle River...including Ferry above Curlew...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast through Thursday. * WHERE...Kettle River near Ferry above Curlew. * WHEN...Until Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19 feet flooding at Beal Park on West Kettle River Road, west of Curlew occurs. Ol` Swimming Hole Park in Curlew will be inundated. Flooding of yards and outbuildings will occur along the river from the Canadian boder through Curlew on both sides of the river. Some driveways on Kettle River Road will be flooded. Water will be over Customs Road near Riverview Lane and between milepost 5 and 6. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM PDT Sunday the stage was 19.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 17.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Thursday late morning and continue falling to 18.0 feet Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 18.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 pm PDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Kettle River Ferry abv Curlew 18.5 19.5 Sun 8 pm PDT 19.0 18.9 18.6 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. Cold water shock can cause loss of muscle function and the rapid onset of hypothermia. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday afternoon at 1200 PM PDT.
